comments.author: Jonathan Kernan
comments.comment: missing javadoc

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: This was just the reinstated class. None of the classes in this package have javadoc. Do you want me to add it?

comments.author: Jonathan Kernan
comments.comment: Yeah could you add some javadoc to this when removing the instance and subset variables?

comments.author: Jonathan Kernan
comments.comment: In terms of respecting componentisation, I think we have agreed to put "global" enums in the com.fineos.common package which you have done. Just curious about why we have a class in fipfacade. From a policy perspective, this should be fine since we have a compile dependency on the enums. Was the claims build failing?

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: This implementation was done prior to that decision. When we spoke we said we would move ContractRole to fipfacade. In doing that, the Claims CI Build failed. So as to limit any impact, I reinstated ContractRole to common & then created a facade class for use in Policy. This class can be removed when the reafcor of enums is done. Will I drop this item so?

comments.author: Jonathan Kernan
comments.comment: Ah ok no worries.

comments.author: Jonathan Kernan
comments.comment: Do we need to expose these fullids and subset name? They're no longer being used by Policy. Can't find any references in absence also.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: I just took wahtever was Policy specific when this implementaiton was done. If the code has been refactored since then, then yes it should be removed. I think I mentioned the _Covered for Risk_ one to you before. Can you raise a jira for a clean up task for this? Could be done in D5?

comments.author: Jonathan Kernan
comments.comment: Yeah I'm fine with leaving till D5

comments.author: Jonathan Kernan
comments.comment: This javadoc is now out of date.

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment: Good point, I used the ddlGeneration gradle task for updating the scripts, but the DB2 scripts remain the same because in DB2 we use BIGINT where there is no lenght specified like Oracle and SQL Server ( i.e. NUMBER(4,0) )

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Why not ""?

comments.author: Gil Matias
comments.comment: On compile interpretation time both are equivalent. I happen to like that one better.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment:
I don't like this change because comparing strings is "dangerous" if they can have the same value but refer to different contexts. orgUnit can have the value "Financial Department" in multiple companies and all of them should be handled as different.
please consider this.

comments.author: Gil Matias
comments.comment: This is used Only between an ocupation in a company and an employee for that company so this should not be an issue. Also in the current leaveplan configuration Only strings are allowed. So there is no other way around besides string compare
